intro: Notholaena arequipensis, commonly known as the Arequipa spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high Andean regions of southern Peru. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, spike-like inflorescences and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in moist, rocky habitats at elevations above 3,000 meters. Notholaena arequipensis plays a role in stabilizing soil in its alpine environment and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation to high-altitude conditions.
